description: It doesn't start. Shows no messages and there's no documentation on how to use this software. What is it good for?

If you are not sure how to use it, google it.
The negative reviews almost made me think that this is some malware disguised as one of the best tools to handle audio/video files...
Worked perfectly as expected. 5/5
Works as expected and there are GUI interfaces available for those who might be a bit squeamish around command line

It looks like developers did this program for themselves.
No documentation AT ALL: even syntax is not described (I am not talking
about functionality which is completely unsolvable puzzle, if one has 
NO SYNTAX description.)
	I was given an advice: learn from community. The only question I would like to pose: where the community gets information from? 

I tried to use some examples suggested by the community: 90% of them DOES NOT WORK!
    Run 
       man ffmpeg
 Can you get some useful information from there,
for sure NO. Just for comparison run
      "man bash"
I believe you fill the difference. So, to use bash 
one shouldn't ask the "community" how to use this (in bash
community you probably will find a lot of not working samples,
but all these samples are "produced" by the
members of the community who did not read "man bash".
summary: JUNK, if your value your time, stay far away from this software

summary: Only shows a terminal, and a second later it vanishes

description:
This is a command-line tool for encoding video and audio.You can execute in command-line.After installing, just write in the terminal:
/snap/bin/ffmpeg and you can see where is the ffmpeg.
does not start could not use

After I'd tried with many other software for screen record and all of them either crashed or failed to encode the video properly, ffmpeg just give me a quick record with simple command line. As far as I've tried, there is no issue such as lagging or speed inconsistency.
Amazing experience with it.

Please ignore the negative reviews from people who don't understand what this does. 

FFMPEG is a background tool used by other aplications for processing video and sound. It doesn't do anything on its own. It is not an application you use directly, rather one used by other aplications you do use directly.
summary: Very happy with this, includes nvec support installed this way

description:
Original review: The Snap version includes hardware acceleration support. The deb version does not. Unfortunately, if you later install something like devede, it will install the slower deb version. Maybe there's an easy fix, but I uninstalled both (which took devede with it) and reinstalled this Snap version.

New comment: If you attempt to run ffmpeg on a folder that is mounted nfs, or bound to such folder, or linked to such folder, it will complain that permission is denied. Grant all the permissions on the folder, or snap, you want. It won't change anything. I really wish this build of ffmpeg was available in the repository instead. The snap framework isn't at all ready for prime time.
summary: This Snap includes hardware acceleration support, but no network

description: Fastest video cutting app without loosing the original video quality.
magically does everything, anyone could possible ask from an audio/video decoder/decoder
If you can't get this program to work (i.e. running in a terminal) maybe you're on the wrong platform, because this program is excellent!

About 6 months into Ubuntu from Mac and still finding my way into CLI life after years of rare use. Installed FFmpeg 4.1.4 into Ubuntu 20.04.1 with Ubuntu's Software app, input ffmpeg in a terminal window and got the terse wall of options and what looks like libraries with an intro usage line. Man ffmpeg gives me about 50 tall pages that looks pretty informative. Presumably the web's loaded with intros and tutorials and maybe there's a GUI with CLI window, so here we go. 
Have been using Handbrake but got tired of needing to manually set some options I always use, for every !@$#% use because it has no way to change defaults. Having read about ffmpeg and the fact it's the guts of Handbrake and most other apps, I figure it's going to be much easier plugging filenames into a standard command line. IF I can manage to figure out the options. We'll see...
works perfectly!
Google for the usage

I use it for
1) splitting and mixing tracks
2) converting audio
3) 50i to 50p - very excellent result
4) changing rate for ex. 30p to 50p - excellent
5) splitting big video to scenes
etc.

Why rated 4:
All mentioned above functions retrieved from examples found on the network. To do something from scratch is almost impossible to use original documentation only.

Howdy
. back in the early Y2K days, Motion JPG and GIF's were made possible by This Software to create Mp4 & MKv files. 
. we at AMV.org loved it so much that Today we have found it indespecable to every day use in Players and Encoders for both Audio and Video Software on All Platforms.
. and, yes, BSD, Linux, Windows and Apple plus Unix all NOW use these standards on Every Distro-World Wide.
summary: This is "what" makes Video Possible - works on its own

description:
I installed this package as Firefox needed it to play videos, but it never initialized. It kept telling me to install the necessary codecs to play video.

I had to ultimately install it through the Terminal. I restarted Firefox and voilá, it played videos without issues. I suggest you to just install it through the Terminal.

App works great! No problems or complaints. qwinff is the first gui I used and it works prefectly so haven't tried or looked for another. ffmpeg documentation available on https://ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg.html
I plan to go through it and learn how to work the program via cli.

sudo apt update
sudo apt -y install qwinff

install qwinff as a gui front-end if you'd prefer not to use terminal for ffmpeg functionality.
summary: Only video conversion app you'll ever need! Highly recommended

description: Works as expected. Please allow removeable media permission by default.

The edge version has been compiled for Nvidia SDK (--enable-nvenc), so it speeds up things if you have a Nvidia GPU.
This is NOT a GUI, even if it has a .desktop file, it's a terminal command. So if you don't use it in the terminal, it simply opens, don't see anything to do and close (it pops and closes down). It's normal behavior. Use it in terminal.
FFMPEG is for doing magical stuff with video, audio and images, but manually.

I would like to recommend very powerful and simple UI video audio converter for linux. 

1. formatlab (too good)
2. panda video converter
summary: Worst and bad GUI video converter!

description:
try panda video converter
very powerfull and easy to use

If you're whinging about this app, you don't know commandline. FFmpeg has saved me HUNDREDS of hours converting, editing and manipulating media. I have it set up with scripts so that I can dump a wad of media files into a directory, flip open a terminal window (opens to the current directory), then type a command and invoke FFmpeg to do bulk conversions. A true beast - but you have to be able to get your hands dirty in commandline.
FFmpeg - a very useful 'swiss knife' for audio and video conversion
summary: FFmpeg - a very useful 'swiss knife' for audio and video conversion

description:
FFmpeg ist das führende Multimedia-Framework, das in der Lage ist, so ziemlich alles zu dekodieren, zu kodieren, zu transkodieren, zu muxen, zu demuxen, zu streamen, zu filtern und abzuspielen, was Menschen und Maschinen geschaffen haben. Es unterstützt die dunkelsten alten Formate bis zur Schneide. Egal, ob sie von einem Normungsausschuss, der Community oder einem Unternehmen entworfen wurden.

Dieser Snap wird von der Snapcrafters-Community verwaltet und nicht unbedingt von den vorgelagerten Entwicklern gebilligt oder offiziell verwaltet.

habe ubuntu 20.04,und aus den packeges ffmpeg installieren lassen, finde nirgends ein icon dass ich mit ffmpeg arbeiten kann, wird zwar angezeigt es ist installiert aber nirgends auffindbar.
was kann ich tun ?

Zusätzlich hatte ich das Paket "libavcodec58" (mit Synaptic-Paketmanager) istalliert, jetzt spielt es jedes Video im Netz ohne Probleme - Klasse!

Additionally I had installed the package "libavcodec58" (with Synaptic package manager), now it plays every video without problems - great!
summary: Yep - that could solve all my problems

FFmpeg es el marco multimedia líder, capaz de decodificar, codificar, transcodificar, mux, demux, transmitir, filtrar y reproducir prácticamente cualquier cosa que los humanos y las máquinas hayan creado. Admite los formatos antiguos más oscuros hasta la vanguardia. No importa si fueron diseñados por algún comité de normas, la comunidad o una corporación.
Este complemento es mantenido por la comunidad Snapcrafters, y no necesariamente es respaldado o mantenido oficialmente por los desarrolladores ascendentes.
